fsw

Class FswApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • fsw.FswApp
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CiLabApp, EsApp, EvsApp, ExApp, FswXmlApp, SbApp, TblApp, TimeApp, ToLabApp

    public abstract class FswApp
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class to represent/model FSW applications. The constants defined in this class should be used for any assumptions made about apps such as maximum number of commands.

    Notes:

    • Name Convention: Start all command and telemetry related constants with "CMD_" and "TLM_". Use second field to ID category like function code (FC) or message ID (MID). For example "CMD_FC_" and "CMD_MID_"
    • Use ArrayList for speed because it does not allocate a new array on the heap.
    TODO - Should error message methods be used? Allows app prefix etc. to be used.
    Author:
    David McComas

    • Constructor Detail

      • FswApp

        protected FswApp(java.lang.String Prefix,
      java.lang.String Name)
        Construct a FSW application. Abstract commands and telemetry definition methods are called during construction. If these functions are empty (i.e. packets definitions not known during at time of construction) then packets can be added later.
        Parameters:
        Prefix - Upper application abbreviation (no underscore)
        Name - Mixed case description name

    • Method Detail

      • defineCmds

        protected abstract void defineCmds()
        Method called during construction to define command packets.

      • defineTlm

        protected abstract void defineTlm()
        Method called during construction to define telemetry packets.

      • getTlmStr

        public abstract java.lang.String getTlmStr(CcsdsTlmPkt TlmMsg)
        This method can be as simple or complex as a child class wants to make it. I thought about putting a MsgID Hashtable in this base class that could be used to look up the method to generate a string (eventually a table for a GUI) but this may be overkill for some applications. Therefore I left it up to the child class to provide all of the implementation details (if-then, switch, etc.). There are some constant strings that should be used for reporting information.

      • getTlmStrArray

        public java.lang.String[] getTlmStrArray(CcsdsTlmPkt TlmMsg)
        This method is intended to simplify the needs of a GUI. The application provides a function that parses the packet and creates a string for each telemetry packet data point.

      • getCmdPkt

        public CmdPkt getCmdPkt(int funcCode)
        Return the CmdPkt for the function code.
        Parameters:
        funcCode - Command function code
        Returns:
        CmdPkt or null if no command defined for the function code

      • setCmdPktMsgId

        public void setCmdPktMsgId(int msgId)
        Typically the message ID is set when the command packet is created and added to the command list. However if the message ID is not known during creation then this allows it to be added to all of the command packets. This assumes one message ID is used for all of an app's commands.
        Parameters:
        msgId -

      • addTlmPkt

        public void addTlmPkt(int tlmMsgId,
             TlmPkt tlmPkt)
        Typically tlm packets are added when the app is created. However if message IDs are not known during creation then this allows the packet to be added when the IDs are assigned/resolved.
        Parameters:
        msgId -
